concept-wr.title: Usage Caveats
concept-wr.shortdesc: There are some usage issues you should be aware of when working with this release.

section.title: 15.12 ini files are not forward compatible with 16.10
section.p: Files must be updated to include two new mandatory keys: MULTICAST_CIDR for MGMT_NETWORK & OAM_NETWORK. The VERSION field must be updated to 16.10.

section.title: For HP ProLiant GEN 9 Servers
section.p: For HP ProLiant GEN 9 servers, turn off RMRR requests in the BIOS before installing or upgrading to this software release. Contact the hardware vendor for more details on the upgrade procedure.

section.title: The minimum firmware version required for Fortville NICs is NVM version 5.04
section.p: Please upgrade the firmware before installing or upgrading to this software release. Contact the hardware vendor for more details on the upgrade procedure.

section.title: Swift Containers and Objects are not saved as part of Backup
section.p: Contact Wind River for a manual procedure to re-create swift stores post restore.

section.title: The auto recovery property in the image metadata is ignored
section.p: To turn auto recovery off for instances booting from volume, set the auto recovery property in the flavor instead.

section.title: VMs reported as ACTIVE before compute nodes are recovered
section.p: During a system recovery (for example, after a site power outage), when the controller is available but before the compute nodes are available, the Nova service shows an Active status for VMs . Until the compute nodes are available, this should be an Error status.

section.title: Mismatch of interface settings in LAG group
section.p: If the interfaces in a LAG group have mismatched speed or duplex settings, they are marked as incompatible by the system. To prevent this, ensure both interfaces in a LAG group use the same speed and duplex settings.

section.title: A node must be re-installed after MAC address change on management interface
section.p: US82332 updated interface namesAny change to the management interface configuration that results in a change of MAC address requires the node to be re-installed. The management interface MAC address can change if the physical Ethernet port is changed (for example, from enpos8 to enpos9), or if a LAG configuration is changed in a way that removes the Ethernet port associated with the LAG MAC address (for example, if the interface originally used for PXE boot is removed or replaced).

section.title: Neutron security groups are not stateful for ICMP protocol
section.p: If a security group does not explicitly allow ingress for ICMP, then incoming responses to outgoing packets using ICMP are blocked. This is in contrast to the OpenStack implementation, where response packets are allowed regardless of ingress rules.

section.title: Hypervisor CPU usage is reported using special notation
section.p: Partial vcpu notation (y.x) is adopted to show shared and dedicated vpcu model usage on the same compute node.
